answers.body_markdown:
The default creation of your package is intent to be installed in `/opt` in a folder of you package name. So, in your case, you should have a directory named `/opt/rakib` with a `bin` directory inside with your executable.

To check where your package is going to be installed just type :

```
$ dpkg --contents [your_package.deb]
```

Using Jpackage, altough it's a valide DEB file, your executable is not directly linked to `/usr/bin`. So it's not on your PATH. I recommend to create a link into youre `~/bin` directory, which should be in your PATH.

If you want to customize the target directory use `--install-dir`.
answers.title: Packaged a Java Application using Jpackage for ubuntu type deb. But giving error when type command (command not found)
answers.body:
The default creation of your package is intent to be installed in /opt in a folder of you package name. So, in your case, you should have a directory named /opt/rakib with a bin directory inside with your executable.

To check where your package is going to be installed just type :

$ dpkg --contents [your_package.deb]

Using Jpackage, altough it's a valide DEB file, your executable is not directly linked to /usr/bin. So it's not on your PATH. I recommend to create a link into youre ~/bin directory, which should be in your PATH.

If you want to customize the target directory use --install-dir.

Then i create a native executable package and installer for ubuntu deb format using Jpackage.

when run command in terminal rakib its can not to recognize.

How can i make this application like as linux command using jpackage?

items.title: FirebaseApp name [DEFAULT] already exists! / Java
items.body:
I try to get rid of the the error "FirebaseApp name [DEFAULT] already". I use my server app for the cloud messaging. Every hour I have to create new google credentials because of the expiration and I thought that I do also have to initialize the App again with the new credentials, is this correct?

Exception in thread "main" java.lang.IllegalStateException: FirebaseApp name [DEFAULT] already exists!
    at com.google.common.base.Preconditions.checkState(Preconditions.java:512)
    at com.google.firebase.FirebaseApp.initializeApp(FirebaseApp.java:222)
    at com.google.firebase.FirebaseApp.initializeApp(FirebaseApp.java:215)
    at com.google.firebase.FirebaseApp.initializeApp(FirebaseApp.java:202)
    at cnotifier.access.FCM.initializeFirebaseApp(FCM.java:70)

My Method to create Credentials

private final static String MESSAGING_SCOPE = "https://www.googleapis.com/auth/firebase.messaging";
private final static String[] SCOPES = { MESSAGING_SCOPE };
private static GoogleCredentials googleCredentials = null;
[...]

public static void createCredentials() throws IOException  {
  FileInputStream serviceAccount = new FileInputStream("/etc/cnotifier/service-account.json");
  googleCredentials = GoogleCredentials.fromStream(serviceAccount).createScoped(Arrays.asList(SCOPES));
        googleCredentials.refresh();
    }

My Method to initialize the app

/**
 * Initializes Firebase SDK
 */
public static void initializeFirebaseApp() throws IOException {
  FirebaseOptions options = FirebaseOptions.builder().setCredentials(googleCredentials).build();
  FirebaseApp.initializeApp(options);
}

Sending the message

public static String sendMessage(Message message) throws FirebaseMessagingException {
  String response = FirebaseMessaging.getInstance().send(message);
        
  return response;
}

Sending notifications to users works so far, but I dont know how to reinit the FirebaseApp when the Google credentials are invalid. I tried to reinit the FirebaseApp when credentials expired and called initializeFirebaseApp() again with new credentials.

Any help for better understanding?

items.title: Testcontainers: DOCKER_HOST is not listening error when running Spring integration tests
items.body:

WARN org.testcontainers.dockerclient.DockerClientProviderStrategy -- DOCKER_HOST unix:///var/run/docker.sock is not listening

I have checked that the Docker daemon is running and that the Docker socket is accessible at /var/run/docker.sock. I have also added my user to the docker group and restarted my system, but I am still getting the same error.

Here is the relevant code from my test class:

@SpringBootTest
@AutoConfigureMockMvc
class ProductServiceApplicationTests {

    @Container
    static MongoDBContainer mongoDBContainer = new MongoDBContainer("mongo:4.4.2");

    @DynamicPropertySource
    static void setProperties(DynamicPropertyRegistry registry) {
        registry.add("spring.data.mongodb.uri", mongoDBContainer::getReplicaSetUrl);
    }

    // ...
}

What could be causing this error, and how can I fix it?
